page.title: List of Israeli price tag attacks

revision.text:
[[File:VandalisedOliveTree.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Olive tree in the village of Burin which was allegedly vandalized by settlers from [[Yitzhar]]]] This is a list of attacks reported or suspected [[Price tag policy|price tag]] ([[Hebrew]]: מדיניות תג מחיר) attacks or violence aimed at the [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] population and at [[Israel]]i security forces<ref>[[B'tselem]], [http://www.btselem.org/settler_violence Background on violence by settlers,'] 2011:'In recent years, settlers have carried out violent acts under the slogan "price tag." These are acts of random violence aimed at the Palestinian population and Israeli security forces.'</ref> by radical [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settlers]], who, according to ''[[The New York Times]]'', "exact a price from local Palestinians or from the Israeli security forces for any action taken against their settlement enterprise".<ref>Isabel Kershner, [https://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/04/world/middleeast/mosque-set-on-fire-in-northern-israel.html Mosque Set on Fire in Northern Israel], at ''[[The New York Times]]'', 3 October 2011:'The attack followed a series of similar assaults on mosques in the West Bank by arsonists suspected of being radical settlers as part of a campaign known as "price tag," which seeks to exact a price from local Palestinians for violence against settlers or from Israeli security forces for taking action against illegal construction in Jewish outposts in the West Bank.'</ref><ref>Uri Friedman, [http://www.theatlanticwire.com/global/2011/10/price-tag-menace-vigilante-israeli-settler-attacks-spread/43226/ The 'Price Tag' Menace: Vigilante Israeli Settler Attacks Spread], at [[The Atlantic Wire]], 3 October 2011:'The New York Times defines price tag attacks as incidents in which radical Jewish settlers "exact a price from local Palestinians or from the Israeli security forces for any action taken against their settlement enterprise".'</ref><ref>Ben Schott, [http://schott.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/07/24/price-tag-policy/ 'Schott's Vocab: A Miscellany of Modern Words & Phrases,'] in ''[[The New York Times]]'', 1 June 2011.</ref> ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' states that the term refers to "a campaign of retribution by [[Jewish fundamentalism|fundamentalist]] Israeli youths against Palestinians in the West Bank".<ref>Joshua Mitnick, [https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052970204612504576608994254954306 Mosque is torched in Israel], in ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'', 4 October 2011.</ref> Over the period from January 2012 to June 2013, Israeli police registered 788 cases of suspected price tag assaults in which 276 arrests were conducted, leading to 154 indictments.<ref name="ynetnews.com">[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4394072,00.html ''Price tag' epidemic: 788 cases, 154 indictments,'] at [[Ynet]], 18 June 2013.</ref>
==2008== * 23 July 2008 – 20 settlers attack the Palestinian village of [[Burin, Nablus|Burin]], smashing cars and windows and cutting electricity wires, after the IDF evacuated settlers from a residence-bus in the illegal outpost of Adei Ad.<ref>The Associated Press & Yuval Azoulay,[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1005198.html 'Settler holds knife to IDF soldier's throat in West Bank riot,'] in [[Haaretz]], 24 July 2008.</ref> * October 2008 – After government attempts to evacuate outposts, settlers unleashed a dog against an Israeli company commander, broke the hand of a deputy battalion commander and punctured the tires of a vehicle of a reserve soldier.<ref name="OCHA, 1 November 2009">[[OCHA]], 1 November 2009.</ref> * 4 December 2008 – After Israeli police evacuated settlers from [[Beit HaShalom]] in Hebron, settlers said they would implement a price tag policy, and three Palestinians, including a father and son, were wounded by gunfire, 12 others injured and 15 cars torched.<ref>Ali Waked, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3633603,00.html 'Hebron burning: Settler fire injures Palestinians,'] in [[Ynet]], 4 December 2008</ref> Follow-up incidents in which settlers threw stones at road junctions, fired and vandalized Palestinian property, cut down olive trees, and slashed vehicle tires occurred in at least 12 other locations throughout the West Bank later that day.<ref name="OCHA, I November, 2009">[[OCHA]], I November, 2009.</ref>
==2009== * 1 June 2009 – Settlers blocked the main [[Qalqilya]]-[[Nablus]] road near the [[Qedumim]] settlement and stoned and assaulted Palestinian drivers trying to remove the debris, injuring 6, after a cell-phone alert had circulated the evening before warning that the Israeli army was about to evacuate the [[Ramat Gilad]] outpost, located east of the [[Karnei Shomron|Qarnei Shomron settlement]] in the [[Qalqilya Governorate]]. Settlers also set fire that day to roughly 1,300 olive trees and 280 dunums of wheat and barley crops belonging residents of Palestinian villages along Road 60 between the Qedumim and [[Yitzhar]] settlements. No evacuation was carried out.<ref name="OCHA, 1 November 2009"/> * 20 July 2009 – After a few uninhabited structures in 3 settlement outposts in the [[Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate|Ramallah]] and [[Nablus Governorate|Nablus]] governorates were removed by Israeli authorities, from over 1,000 to 1,500 olive trees belonging villagers from [[Tell, Nablus|Tell]], Madama, [[Burin, Nablus|Burin]], [[Asira al-Qibliya]] and [[Jit, Qalqilya|Jit]] were destroyed. Cars were stoned, junctions blocked, two Palestinian motorists were injured, and six vehicles damaged near [[Nablus]] in an attack attributed by Palestinians to settlers from [[Yitzhar]].<ref name="OCHA, I November, 2009"/><ref>Sheera Frenkel, [http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/middle_east/article6721173.ece Israeli settlers burn olive groves in ‘price tag’ retaliation attack], in [[The Times]], 21 July 2009.</ref> * 23 July 2009 – Connected to the events 3 days earlier, over 20 armed settlers from an outpost near Yitzhar entered the village of [[Asira al-Qibliya]] and hurled stones at the villagers. When the villagers responded with stones, Israeli security forces arrived, fired sound bombs and teargas at them, resulting in the injury of one Palestinian boy.<ref name="OCHA, I November, 2009"/> * 9 September 2009 – After Israeli forces removed the temporary structures in the outpost of Ramat Haregel in the [[Hebron Governorate]], more than 10 settlers from the Israeli settlement of [[Susiya]], went to the neighbouring Palestinian village of that name, hurled stones and physically assaulted the villagers, resulting in injuries to 15 members of a family, including 10 children. After Israeli forces intervened, the settlers returned to Susiya, none were detained, and the outpost was reconstructed that night.<ref name="OCHA, 1 November 2009"/> * 14 October 2009 – Some 200 olive trees belonging to the village of [[Al-Mughayyir, Ramallah|Al Mughayyir]], were felled by settlers from the illegal settler oupost at [[Adei Ad]], near [[Shvut Rachel]].<ref>[http://www.economist.com/node/14660454 'Not much of an olive branch,'], in [[The Economist]], 15 October 2009.</ref> * 9 December 2009 – The Hasan Khadr Mosque at the village of [[Yasuf]] near [[Salfit]] was burnt, with 'price tag' slogan written on the wall.<ref>Ali Waked,with Efraim Weiss, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3818465,00.html 'Settlers suspected of torching Palestinian mosque,'] in [[Ynet]], 11 December 2009.</ref> In January 2010, several settlers from the Yitzhar settlement were arrested as suspects.<ref>[http://www.imemc.org/article/57664 'Nine Settlers, Including Three Teens, Arrested For Involvement in Salfit Mosque Attack,'] in [[International Middle East Media Center]], 18 January 2010.</ref>
==2010== * April 2010 – Settlers torched three Palestinian vehicles in [[Huwara]] near Nablus.<ref name=autogenerated6>Saed Bannoura, [http://www.imemc.org/article/58670 'Settler Torch Olive Orchard In Silwan,'] in [[International Middle East Media Center]], 13 May 2010.</ref> * 4 May 2010 – Settlers torched the main mosque of the [[Al-Lubban ash-Sharqiya|al-Lubban al-Sharqiyya]] village, its extensive carpets and Korans, south of Nablus.<ref name=autogenerated6 /> * 12 May 2010 – Fundamentalist settlers torched an 11-[[Dunam]] olive orchard in al-Rababa valley, in [[Silwan]], destroying 3 300-year-old trees in the grove and damaging many others.<ref name=autogenerated6 /> * May 2010 – Settlers from [[Metzad|Asfar]] burned more than 200 trees belonging to Palestinians from the village of [[Sa'ir]], near [[Hebron]].<ref>Mohamad Alasmar, [http://www.jpost.com/Opinion/Op-EdContributors/Article.aspx%3Fid%3D185198Paying for the ‘price-tag’ policy,'] in [[Jerusalem Post]], 18 August 2010 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> * 25 July 2010 – In retaliation for the government's demolition of two caravans and a goat pen at Givat Ronen, settlers embarked on a price tag mission involving protests, road blocks and an attempt to torch an open field. One villager of [[Burin, Nablus|Burin]] was injured in clashes with the settlers, and four settlers were wounded, one seriously.<ref name=autogenerated8>Aviel Magnezi, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3925522,00.html 'Settlers block roads, clash with police,'] (in Hebrew) [Ynet], 26 July 2010.</ref><ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3925135,00.html West Bank demolitions prompt riots, arrests, 'price tag' missions], YNet</ref> * 16 August 2010 – 250 olive trees in the villages of [[Kosra]] and [[Jaloud]], near [[Nablus]], were uprooted by settlers from [[Shvut Rachel]], according to an official of the [[Palestinian National Authority|PNA]].<ref>Mohammed Mar'i, [http://arabnews.com/middleeast/article104127.ece 'Occupiers uproot olive trees in West Bank,'] [[Arab News]], 17 August 2010. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100902022650/http://arabnews.com/middleeast/article104127.ece |date=September 2, 2010 }}</ref> * 3 October 2010 – Arsonists, suspected of coming from [[Gush Etzion]], set fire to rugs, defaced a Koran, and scrawled 'revenge' on the walls of the mosque of Al Fajjar/Beit Fajar, near [[Bethlehem]].<ref>[[Ethan Bronner]], [https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/05/world/middleeast/05mideast.html Arsonists Damage a Mosque in the West Bank], in [The New York Times], 4 October 2010.</ref><ref>Reuters, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/settlers-replace-korans-burnt-in-west-bank-mosque-attack-1.317361 Settlers replace Korans burnt in West Bank mosque attack,'] in [[Haaretz]], 5 October 2010.</ref> * 13–14 October 2010 – Two vehicles, owned by a Palestinians were set on fire in [[Qusra]], and branded with a 'price tag' slogan, according to [[B'tselem]].<ref>B'tselem, [http://www.btselem.org/settler_violence/20101103_settlers_torch_vehicles_in_qusra_14_oct_2010'Violence by Settlers,'] 3 November 2010, {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *15 October 2010 – A 500-dunam olive grove by the village of Farata was firebombed by settlers from the wildcat Jewish settlement of [[Havat Gilad]]<ref>[[Agence France-Presse]], [http://www.france24.com/en/20101016-israel-settlers-start-fires-amid-west-bank-harvest?quicktabs_1=0 'Israel settlers start fires amid West Bank harvest ,'], 16 October 2010. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> as part of a price tag operation. According to eyewitness Rabbi Yehiel Grenimann, who notified authorities as the arson attack got underway, Israeli soldiers prevented fire trucks from entering to put out the blaze for an hour, and local Palestinians asking for their assistance were themselves detained for three hours.<ref name=autogenerated14>Joshua Bloom, [http://www.rhr-na.org/blog/%3Fp%3D106 'Operation Price Tag,'] in [[Rabbis for Human Rights]], 25 October 2010. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *19 October 2010 – [[Rabbis for Human Rights]] reported a girls' school at [[As-Sawiya]] was broken into, and a schoolroom burnt.<ref name=autogenerated14 />
==2011== [[File:Star of david on car, Qusra, Palestine.JPG|thumb|Hebrew text in Qusra mosque, after "price-tag" attack by settlers, in September 2011.]] [[File:"Mo is a pig" sttler graffitti in Qusra, Palestine.JPG|thumb|Hebrew text on the wall of the Qusra mosque, after "price-tag" attack by settlers, in September 2011.]] * 27 February 2011 – In a price-tag operation against the evacuation of [[Havat Gilad]], settlers threw [[molotov cocktails]] at a house in the village of [[Huwara]].<ref>Yair Altman, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4035962,00.html Price tag: Palestinian cars vandalized in Hebron.'] in [[Ynet]], 1 March 2011.</ref> * 28 February 2011 – Dozens of windshields of Palestinian cars were smashed in [[Hebron]] in retaliation for the recent evacuation of [[Havat Gilad]].<ref>Yair Altman, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4035962,00.html Price tag: Palestinian cars vandalized in Hebron.'] in [[Ynet]], 1 March 2011</ref> * 4 March 2011 – Settlers from Shvut Rachel damaged roughly 500 olive trees belonging to the village of [[Sorra]], near [[Nablus]], and stoned homes, apparently in reprisal for the dismantling of several mobile homes.<ref>Ahmad Jaradat, [http://www.alternativenews.org/english/index.php/topics/hebron/3656-israeli-settler-violence-report-march-and-april-2011 'Israeli Settler Violence Report: March and April 2011,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111124070548/http://www.alternativenews.org/english/index.php/topics/hebron/3656-israeli-settler-violence-report-march-and-april-2011# |date=2011-11-24 }} in [[Alternative Information Center]], 12 June 2011: 'On 4 March, settlers from Shvut Rachel in the southeast Nablus District damaged around 500 olive trees belonging to families from the village of Sorra. According to the Palestinian settlement file office in the northern West Bank, "the settlers attacked in the early morning hours, damaging and uprooting about 500 olive trees. Some of the settlers also entered the village and stoned homes". These attacks are part of the settlers' "price tag" plan, announced against Palestinians in the West Bank. The plan was ostensibly launched because the Israeli army dismantled several mobile houses in some outposts and settlements in West Bank, including the outpost of Giv'at Gil'ad in the North.' {{cite web |url=http://www.alternativenews.org/english/index.php/topics/hebron/3656-israeli-settler-violence-report-march-and-april-2011 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-09-14 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111124070548/http://www.alternativenews.org/english/index.php/topics/hebron/3656-israeli-settler-violence-report-march-and-april-2011 |archivedate=November 24, 2011 |df= }}</ref> * 17 March 2011 – 5 to 7 Jewish men, using a metal pipe and tear gas, assaulted two Palestinian labourers renovating a house on the edge of the settlement of [[Shilo, Mateh Binyamin|Shilo]]h. A Jewish security guard protecting them was also injured slightly.<ref>Yaakov Lappin, [http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx%3FID%3D212555%26R%3DR1 'Settlers suspected of 'price tag' attack in Shiloh ,'] in [[Jerusalem Post]], 17 March 2011. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121026015256/http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx?ID=212555&R=R1 |date=26 October 2012 }}</ref><ref>Elior Levy [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4044004,00.html 'Palestinian 'price tag' victim recounts attack,'] in [[Ynet]], 17 March 2011.</ref> * 6 June 2011 – A mosque was defaced and damaged in [[Al-Mughayyir, Ramallah|Al Mughayyir]], near [[Ramallah]]<ref>[[Isabel Kershner]],[https://www.nytimes.com/2011/06/08/world/middleeast/08mideast.html?_r=1 Arsonists Damage and Deface Mosque in West Bank Village], in ''[[The New York Times]]'', 7 June 2011.</ref> * 25 July 2011 – Settlers torched the farmlands of the village of Sorra, after Israeli soldiers intervened to stop Israeli peace activists from preventing a group of settlers from uprooting trees, according to IMEMC.<ref>Saed Bannoura, ['Settlers Torch Palestinian Farmlands Near Nablus,'] [[International Middle East Media Center|IMEMC]] 26 July 2011.</ref> * 5 September 2011 – Settlers torched the mosque of [[Qusra]], south of [[Nablus]].<ref>Chaim Levinson & Avi Issacharoff [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/settlers-set-fire-to-west-bank-mosque-after-israel-demolishes-illegal-structures-in-migron-1.382617 Settlers set fire to West Bank mosque after Israel demolishes illegal structures in Migron], in [[Haaretz]], 5 September 2011.</ref> * 7 September 2011 – Unknown perpetrators slashed the tires and cut the cables of 12 army vehicles at an IDF base, in retaliation for the demolition of 3 homes at the illegal settlement of [[Migron, Mateh Binyamin|Migron]].<ref>Anshel Pfeffer & Chaim Levinson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israeli-settlers-vandalize-idf-base-in-first-price-tag-act-against-army-1.383068 Israeli settlers vandalize IDF base in first 'price tag' act against army], in [[Haaretz]], 7 September 2011.</ref> * 8 September 2011 – Settler youths made an attempt to deface the mosque of the village of [[Yatma]], near [[Rechelim]] and [[Kfar Tapuach]], in the [[Nablus Governorate]] in a price tag assault.<ref name="jpost.com">JPost staff [http://www.jpost.com/Headlines/Article.aspx?id=237390 'US condemns 'price-tag' attacks on W. Bank mosques,'] in [[Jerusalem Post]], 9 September 2011.</ref><ref>Quamar Mishirqi-Asad,[http://rhr.org.il/eng/index.php/2011/09/high-price-tag-in-the-mosque-of-the-village-yatma/ 'High ‘Price Tag’ in the Mosque of the Village Yatma,'] in [[Rabbis for Human Rights]], 13 September 2011. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120903115731/http://rhr.org.il/eng/index.php/2011/09/high-price-tag-in-the-mosque-of-the-village-yatma/ |date=September 3, 2012 }}</ref> * 9 September 2011 – Graffiti slogans in Hebrew were sprayed on the Amir Hassan mosque in [[Birzeit]] and over a wall of the [[Birzeit University]] near [[Ramallah]]. The graffiti said:"Mohammad is a pig" and "death to Arabs." <ref>Elior Levy, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4120144,00.html Price tag' operations continue in WB,'] at [[Ynet]], 9 September 2011.</ref> * 11 September 2011 – house of a left-wing activist in Jerusalem defaced with graffiti proclaiming "death to the traitors" and "price tag Migron"<ref>Oz Rosenberg,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/home-of-israeli-left-wing-activist-defaced-in-latest-price-tag-act-1.383966 'Home of Israeli left-wing activist defaced in latest 'price tag' act,'] at Haaretz, 12 September 2011.</ref> *25 September 2011 – Roughly 100 olive trees felled in the village of [[Duma, Nablus|Doma]] south of Nablus, in a suspected price-tag action.<ref>Yair Altman,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4127190,00.html Suspected 'price tag' act: Olive trees cut down in West Bank] in [[Ynet]], 25 September 2011.</ref> * 28 September 2011 – A grove of 45 olive trees uprooted near [[Hebron]], apparently in reprisal for the death of a settler and his son.<ref>Yair Altman, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3976976,00.html Olive trees uprooted near Hebron], in [[Ynet]], 29 September 2011.</ref> * 3 October 2011 – Burning of a mosque at the Bedouin town [[Tuba-Zangariyye]] in the North District of Israel.<ref>Hassan Shaalan [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4130148,00.html 'Price tag: Mosque torched in Upper Galilee,'] in Ynet, 3 October 2011</ref> * 5 October 2011 – Settlers Uprooted 200 Olive Tree at [[Qusra]], near [[Nablus]].<ref>Saed Bannoura, [http://www.imemc.org/article/62198 'Settlers Uproot 200 Olive Tree Near Nablus,'] in  – [[International Middle East Media Center|IMEMC]], 6 October 2011.</ref> * 7 October 2011 – Two cemeteries – one Christian and one Muslim – in [[Jaffa]] desecrated with far-right graffiti, including "price tag" and "death to Arabs.".<ref>Ravid Barak, Avi Issacharoff, Chaim Levinson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/muslim-christian-graves-in-jaffa-defaced-with-racist-slogans-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.388822 Christian graves in Jaffa defaced with racist slogans in suspected 'Price Tag' attack,'] in [[Haaretz]], 8 October 2011.</ref><ref name="Ben Hartman 2013">Ben Hartman, [http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Vandals-deface-Christian-cemetery-in-Jaffa-316427 'Vandals deface Christian cemetery in Jaffa,'] at [[Jerusalem Post]], 13 June 2013.</ref> * 11 October 2011 – The [[Yitzchak Rabin]] memorial in [[Tel Aviv]] was desecrated, when a vandal sprayed the words "price tag" and "release [[Yigal Amir]]" on the memorial.<ref>Ilan Lior and Haaretz, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/tel-aviv-yitzchak-rabin-memorial-desecrated-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.389875 Israel man vandalizes Rabin memorial in protest of Shalit deal]. in [[Haaretz]], 14 October 2011.</ref> * 25 October 2011 – 20 trees from an olive grove at [[Beit Safafa]] owned by an Arab family of Jerusalem uprooted, with a price-tag sign posted nearby.<ref>Oz Rosenberg, http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/suspected-right-wing-extremists-uproot-20-olive-trees-belonging-to-jerusalem-arab-family-1.392341 'Suspected right-wing extremists uproot 20 olive trees belonging to Jerusalem Arab family,'] at [[Haaretz]], 27 October 2011.</ref> * 30 October 2011 – Vandals torched an Arab restaurant in [[Jaffa]], and, according to a Tel Aviv-Jaffa city council member, the phrases "price tag" and "[[Meir Kahane|Kahane]] was right." were scrawled on its walls.<ref>Jack Khoury [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/vandals-set-fire-to-arab-restaurant-in-jaffa-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.392931 'Vandals set fire to Arab restaurant in Jaffa in suspected 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]], 31 October 2011</ref> *7 December 2011 – Arsonists tried to set fire to the mosque of the Palestinian village of Burkina, near the settlement of [[Ariel (city)|Ariel]], and also torched two Palestinian vehicles, in a suspected 'price tag' assault.<ref>Chaim Levinson,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/west-bank-mosque-set-alight-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.400129 West Bank mosque set alight in suspected 'price tag' attack], at Haaretz, 7 December 2011.</ref> * 13 December 2011 – 50 settlers and right-wing Jewish activists broke into the Efraim Regional Brigade Headquarters near the settlement of [[Kedumim]], damaging military vehicles, torching tires, hurling [[Molotov cocktail]]s and throwing rocks. An IDF spokesman Brig.-Gen. Yoav Mordechai however refrained from using this term for the incident, noting that IDF Chief of General Staff Lt.-Gen. [[Benny Gantz]] hasn't used it for some time, and said that it needed to be defined correctly.<ref>Yaakov Katz, [http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx%3FID%3D249229%26R%3DR1 'Settlers break into IDF base in 'price tag' attack,'] at [[JPost]].com, 13 December 2011 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref>Yair Altman,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4160819,00.html 'Settlers raid IDF base, injure commander,'] at [[Ynet]], 13 December 2011.</ref> * 13–14 Dec 2011 – Arsonists torched the [[Nebi Akasha Mosque]] in [[Jerusalem]] marking the burial site of an Islamic prophet, [[Battle of Buzakha|Akasha bin Mohsin]], in a suspected price tag action.<ref>Oz Rosenberg, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/jerusalem-mosque-set-alight-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.401330 'Jerusalem mosque set alight in suspected 'price tag' attack,'], at [[Haaretz]], 14 December 2011.</ref> * 14–15 Dec 2011 – Arsonists defaced and torched the mosque at the Palestinian village of [[Burqa, Nablus|Burqa]] near Nablus, The slogans "Mitzpe Yitzhar" and "War," scrawled on the mosque suggest this was a 'price tag' retaliation for the dismantlement of the illegal settlement of [[Yitzhar|Mitzpe Yitzhar]] conducted earlier by the IDF.<ref>Elior Levy [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4162045,00.html 'West Bank Mosque torched,'] at [[Ynet]], 15 December 2011.</ref> * 18 December 2011 – Hate slogans and the signature 'price tag' defaced the walls of the mosque of [[Bnei Naim]], east of Hebron.<ref>Elior Levy, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4163909,00.html 'Hate slogans sprayed on mosque near Hebron,'] at [[Ynet]], 19 December 2011</ref>
==2012== 56 price tag attacks, the majority against Palestinians, took place in Jerusalem alone over 2012. Suspects were arrested for 12 such incidents, though not all of them were indicted.<ref name="Noam 2013">Noam (Dabul) Dvir, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4435142,00.html ''Price tag' in Old City; cars vandalized,'], [[Ynet]], 1 October 2013.</ref> Some 623 price-tag related cases were investigated, involving 200 arrests and the filing of 123 indictments.<ref name="ynetnews.com"/>
* 5 January 2012 – In what police described as a 'price tag' attack, a Palestinian car-wash [[Shuafat]] was set on fire, and a GMC minivan and a truck belonging to Palestinians also incinerated.<ref>Oz Rosenberg, [http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/israel-police-suspect-rightist-extremists-set-fire-to-palestinian-car-wash-1.405513 Israel Police suspect rightist extremists set fire to Palestinian car wash,'] at [[Haaretz]], 5 Jan 2012.</ref> * 11 January 2012 – A mosque at the West Bank Palestinian village of [[Deir Istiya|Dir Istiyya]] was defaced with graffiti, reading 'Price tag' and 'Gal Arye Yosef' (an illegal outpost, demolished some days earlier, near [[Itamar]]),' in Hebrew, and three cars nearby were torched.<ref>[[Associated Press]],[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/israel-police-west-bank-mosque-defaced-cars-torched-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.406690Israel 'Police: West Bank mosque defaced, cars torched in suspected 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]], January 11, 2012. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> * 16 January 2012 – Mohammad Ghannam, brother of [[Ramallah Governorate|Ramallah's governor]], Leila Ghannam, had his car torched outside [[Deir Dibwan]] village near [[Ramallah]] in a possible price tag operation.<ref>Avi Issacharoff [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/senior-palestinian-official-says-israeli-settlers-torched-his-car-in-ramallah-1.407581 Senior Palestinian official says Israeli settlers torched his car in Ramallah], at [[Haaretz]], 16 January 2012.</ref> * 7 February 2012 – In Jerusalem, a Jewish-Arab bilingual school, a symbol of coexistence, in which half the students are Jews and half are Arab, and the 11th-century [[Monastery of the Cross]] administered by the Greek Orthodox church were defaced with graffiti saying "Death to Arabs", "Kahane was right" and "Death to Christians" as well as "price tag". The two incidents, suspected of being 'price tag' attacks carried out by Jewish extremists,<ref>Talila Nesher and Oz Rosenberg, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/jerusalem-monastery-jewish-arab-school-defaced-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.411533Jerusalem monastery, Jewish-Arab school defaced in suspected 'price tag'attack], at [[Haaretz]], 7 Feb 2012 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> were later attributed to two Bedouin youths, who confessed to the acts.<ref>{{cite web|title=Arab Youths Confessed to Spraying 'Death to Arabs'|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/arab-youths-confessed-to-spraying-death-to-arabs/2012/03/13/|publisher=Jewish Press|accessdate=March 13, 2012}}</ref> * 20 February 2012 – Vandals daubed "Death to Christianity", "Jesus is dead," and "Mary was a prostitute" <ref>Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/jerusalem-christians-are-latest-targets-in-recent-spate-of-price-tag-attacks-1.413848 'Jerusalem Christians are latest targets in recent spate of 'price tag' attacks,'] at [[Haaretz]], 21 February 2012.</ref> on the Jerusalem Baptist Narkis Street Congregation church, and slashed the tires of several cars parked in the compound. The acts were countersigned by price tag graffiti.<ref>Reuters/Ynet [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4192097,00.html 'Vandals scrawl graffiti on Jerusalem Baptist church,'] at [[Ynet]], 20 February 2012.</ref><ref>Ori Lewis, [https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/02/20/us-israel-church-vandals-idUSTRE81J0CU20120220&sa=U&ei=QE1CT6WVKM7c4QT7tdC6CA&ved=0CBsQqQIwAA&sig2=LBXwl3LS0KB1IUfwVk5jSg&usg=AFQjCNGRcZGyMS72uDEjFZfijZN0alUZ1Q Vandals scrawl graffiti on Jerusalem Baptist church], at [[Reuters]], 20 February 2012. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> * June 8, 2012 – The tires of 14 cars were slashed and graffiti, including 'death to Arabs,' 'revenge', 'Kahane was right,' 'regards from Havat Gilad,' [[Beit El|Ulpana neighbourhood]],' and 'price tag', painted over the vehicles of residents of the Jewish-Arab village of [[Neve Shalom]].<ref>Nir Hasson, Oz Rosenberg [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/racist-graffiti-sprayed-at-mixed-jewish-arab-village-in-central-israel-1.435216 'Racist graffiti sprayed at mixed Jewish-Arab village in central Israel,'] at [[Haaretz]], June 8, 2012.</ref> *19 June 2012 – The 'Grand Mosque' the West Bank village of [[Jab'a]] was set alight and sprayed with the graffiti, 'The war has begun', and 'price tag', apparently in response to the evacuation of the Jewish settlement at [[Beit El|Ulpana]].<ref>Gil Cohen, Chaim Levinson [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/mosque-in-west-bank-village-set-alight-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-1.437267 Mosque in West Bank village set alight in suspected ‘price tag’ attack,’] at [[Haaretz]], 19 June 2012</ref><ref>Jodi Rudoren, Khaled Abu Aker, [https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/20/world/europe/west-bank-mosque-is-set-ablaze-and-vandalized.html?src=rechp 'West Bank Mosque Is Set Ablaze and Vandalized,'], at ''[[The New York Times]]'', 19 June 2012</ref> * 1 August 2012 – A Palestinian family in [[Sinjil]], between the settlements of [[Shilo, Mateh Binyamin|Shilo]]h and [[Ma'aleh Levona]] found plastic containers of benzine under their pickup truck, and a graffiti in Hebrew: "Don't you touch the lands" written on it.<ref>[[Amira Hass]], [http://www.haaretz.com/news/features/otherwise-occupied-caught-between-price-tag-and-red-tape.premium-1.456197 ''Otherwise Occupied / Caught between Price Tag and red tape,''] at [[Haaretz]], August 6, 2012.</ref> * 23 August 2012 – Unidentified assailants, described by local Palestinians only as settlers wearing [[Kippa|kippot]], tried to torch two cars, after writing graffiti on them, in the West Bank village of [[Awarta]].<ref>Nida Tuma, Ben Hartman, [http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx%3Fid%3D282248 'W. Bank cars damaged in suspected ‘price-tag’ attack,'] at [[Jerusalem Post]], 23 August 2012. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120904143429/http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx?id=282248 |date= 4 September 2012 }}</ref> * 27 August 2012 -A car was torched, and others sprayed with graffiti reading "Price Tag", "Migron", "death to the enemy"and "Revenge to Arabs," at [[Jalazone|Jalazone refugee camp]] north of [[Ramallah]] overnight after reports that settlers were in the area.<ref>Itamar Fleishman [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4274365,00.html 'Cars torched, vandalized near Ramallah,'] at [[Ynet]], 29 August 2012.</ref> * 4 September 2012 -. Graffiti reading "Jesus is a monkey" were sprayed on a Christian monastery, and its door was set on fire, at [[Latrun]] in a suspected price tag attack for the evacuation of [[Migron, Mateh Binyamin|Migron]].<ref>Oz Rosenberg, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/christian-monastery-near-jerusalem-vandalized-door-set-on-fire-1.462622 'Christian monastery near Jerusalem vandalized, door set on fire,'] at [[Haaretz]], 4 September 2012</ref> In late June, 2013, police arrested a [[Bnei Brak]] resident on suspicion that he had been involved in the incident.<ref>Yaniv Kubovich,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/right-wing-activist-arrested-in-connection-to-price-tag-attack-on-monastery-1.533096 ' Right-wing activist arrested in connection to 'price tag' attack on monastery,'] [[Haaretz]], 1 July 2013.</ref> * 3 October 2012 -The entrance to the [[Dormition Abbey|Church of the Dormition]] on [[Mount Zion]] was sprayed with graffiti that read "Jesus, son of a bitch, price tag."<ref>Oz Rosenberg and Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/another-israeli-church-defaced-with-price-tag-graffiti-1.467930 'Another Israeli church defaced with 'price tag' graffiti,'] at [[Haaretz]], 3 October 2012.</ref> * 22 October 2012 – A car was set on fire and graffiti, reading " [[Susia|price-tag Susia]] " and "regards from [[Meir Kahane|Meir Ettinger]]." sprayed on the entrance to a village in the [[Hebron]] area.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/palestinian-taxi-set-on-fire-in-suspected-price-tag-attack-in-hebron-hills-1.471600'Palestinian taxi set on fire in suspected 'price-tag' attack in Hebron Hills,'] at [[Haaretz]] 22 October 2012. {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> * 25 November 2012– 8 Palestinian cars in [[Shuafat]] were vandalized with price-tag slogans that read:'Gaza Price Tag'.<ref>Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/palestinian-cars-vandalized-in-jerusalem-in-suspected-price-tag-attack.premium-1.480342 'Palestinian cars vandalized in Jerusalem, in suspected 'price tag' attack,'], at Haaretz 25 November 2012</ref> * 3 December 2012 -3 youths were arrested while endeavouring to vandalise property at the West Bank village of [[as-Samu|Samu'a]], after apparently torching a car and spraying price-tag grffiti in the nearby town of [[ad-Dhahiriya]].<ref>Itamar Fleishman,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4314938,00.html '3 arrested for vandalizing Palestinian property,'] at [[Ynet]], 3 December 2012.</ref>
==2013== From January to November 120 price tag attacks against Arabs in the [[Mateh Binyamin Regional Council|Binyamin]] /[[Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate|al-Bireh]] area of the north West Bank, leading one Israeli security official to state that these acts might have a destructive impact by motivating Palestinians to engage in terror. Whereas no Israeli had been killed in 2012, 4 had been murdered as of November, 2013.<ref>Gili Cohen,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.558370 'Senior IDF officer: Recent anti-Palestinian attack could spark terror in West Bank,'] at Haaretz 16 November 2013.</ref> From January to June 2013 165 cases involving price-tag attacks were opened, some 76 suspects were arrested and 31 indictments were filed.<ref name="ynetnews.com"/>
* 1 January 2013 Graffiti "Price tag. The only good Arab is a dead Arab. Vengeance for Yitzhar," and "This time on buildings, next time on humans," were sprayed on the village of [[Beit Umar]], near [[Hebron]].<ref>[http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=6914 'Suspected 'price-tag' attack on Palestinian village,'] at [[Israel Hayom]], 1 January 2013.</ref> *3 January 2013 According to Palestinian, in a village south of Nablus, four cars had their tires slashed, with the words "Solidarity with [[Esh Kodesh]]" (an [[Israeli outpost]]), and a [[Star of David]] spray-painted on a nearby wall.<ref>Itamar Fleischman,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4328343,00.html 'Suspected 'price tag' attack near Nablus,'] at [[Ynet]], 3 January 2013.</ref> *5 February 2013. Two cars were set on fired, and graffiti, reading '"Jewish blood is not cheap. Tapuah is Kahane.", 'sprayed on a nearby wall, at [[Deir Jarir]], east of [[Ramallah]]. Both the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] and [[B'tselem]] assume the act was a price-tag incident. The slogan may refer to an incident in which a Jewish boy was knifed at Tapuah Junction, near [[Kfar Tapuah]], where many followers of [[Meir Kahane]] live.<ref>Tovah Lazaroff,[http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/Two-cars-torched-in-West-Bank-price-tag-attack 'Two cars torched in West Bank price tag attack ,'] at [[Jerusalem Post]], 5 February 2013.</ref> *14 February 2013. Price-tag" vandals, protesting demolitions at the [[Israeli outpost]] of [[Ma'ale Rehav'am]] in the [[West Bank]], targeted an historic Muslim cemetery in Jerusalem by spraying [[Star of David|Jewish stars]] and price tag slogans on 10 Muslim gravestones.<ref>Melanie Lidman, [http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx?id=303272 'Price tag' suspects vandalize Muslim cemetery,'] at [[Jerusalem Post]], 14 February 2013.</ref> *18 February 2013 At Palestinian village of [[Yasuf]] near the settlement of [[Kfar Tapuah]] the tires of three cars were slashed and a wall daubed with the slogan "price tag, stone terror", according to local villagers by a carload of settlers.<ref>Asher Zeiger,[http://www.timesofisrael.com/cars-vandalized-wall-painted-in-price-tag-attack/ 'Cars vandalized, wall painted in ‘price tag’ attack,'] at [[The Times of Israel]], 18 February 2013.</ref> *21 February 2013.Jewish extremists reportedly vandalized 6 cars, torching 4 of them, in the village of [[Qusra]], according to [[B'tselem]]. IDF confirmation was lacking due to safety concerns over entering the village, but the Palestinian Prime Minister [[Salam Fayyad]] condemned both the incident as a "price tag" attack and also the IDF's demolition of electricity poles in Qusra a day earlier.<ref>Tovah Lavaroff,[http://www.jpost.com/DiplomacyAndPolitics/Article.aspx?id=304099 'Six Palestinian cars torched in price tag attack ,'], at [[Jerusalem Post]], 21 February 2013.</ref> Israeli Police later concluded the attack had been 'staged' by Palestinians based on forensic evidence as well an Israeli ID card, reported lost by a soldier, which Palestinians claimed to find at the scene. B'tselem replied that the police report was 'the quickest police investigation ever'<ref>Ben Hartman, Tozah Lazaroff, [http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/Palestinians-may-have-faked-price-tag-attack 'Palestinians may have faked price tag attack'] [[Jerusalem Post]] 28 February 2013</ref> * 6 March 2013. A [[Mevaseret Zion]] resident was arrested, while caught in the act, for vandalising Palestinian cars, and spraying "death to Arabs," in an industrial park in the [[Shilo, Mateh Binyamin|Shilo]]h settlement near Jerusalem.<ref>Efrat Forsher, [http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=7741 'Son of government employee suspected of price-tag attacks,'] 6 March 2013.</ref> * 8 March 2013. In Alsawiyah, near [[Tapuah]]. seventy-five olive trees were cut down to stumps. Another twenty-one mature olive trees were clear-cut. "Price Tag" was sprayed in the area, as well as illegible scrawlings, possibly "Non-Jewish Terrorism." <ref>[http://rhr.org.il/eng/2013/03/jewish-terrorism-an-especially-violent-price-tag-incident/ 'Jewish Terrorism: an Especially Violent ‘Price Tag’ Incident,’ ] at [[Rabbis for Human Rights]], 10 March 2013 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130529032645/http://rhr.org.il/eng/2013/03/jewish-terrorism-an-especially-violent-price-tag-incident/ |date=May 29, 2013 }}</ref> * 7 April 2013. Vandals defaced two mosques, and slashed the tires of several cars in the Palestinian village of [[Tuqu'|Tekoa]], reportedly in retaliation for stone-throwing incidents, and in revenge for injuries from stoning sustained by a baby at the settlement of [[Ariel (city)|Ariel]] in the preceding month.<ref>Jack Khoury [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/vandals-deface-two-west-bank-mosques-in-suspected-price-tag-attack.premium-1.514079 'Vandals deface two West Bank mosques in suspected 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]], 78 April, 2013.</ref> * 22 April 2013 Overnight 15 Palestinian cars were torched in separate incidents ascribed to 'price tag' vandals. 11 of the cars were set alight in [[Deir Jarir]], destroying four completely. No graffiti were found but local Palestinians blamed the vandalism on settlers.<ref>Asher Zeiger, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/4-jewish-teens-arrested-in-beating-of-arab-youth/ '4 Jewish teens arrested in beating of Arab youth,'] at [[The Times of Israel]], 23 April 2013.</ref> * 23 April 2013. Four vehicles owned by an Israeli-Arab were put to the torch at [['Akbara|Akbara]], a village near [[Safed]]. Graffiti reading "don't touch our girls price tag,' were found nearby.<ref>Maor Buchnik, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4371435,00.html 'Cars torched in Arab village; 'don't touch our girls','] at [[Ynet]], 23 April 2013.</ref> *24 April 2013 After a burglary of an Arab residence in Tel Aviv, graffiti reading "Death to Arabs" "Go away" and "Price tag" were found on the door of their apartment.<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4372425,00.html 'Tel Aviv: 'Price tag' graffiti found in Arabs' apartment door,'] at [[Ynet]], 24 April 2013</ref> * 30 April 2013. Settlers entered the village of [[Beitillu|Beit Ilu]] and sprayed "price tag" graffiti opn one of the homes.<ref>Itamar Fleishman) [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4374582,00.html 'Settlers spray-paint ‘price tag’ on house in Beit Ilu,'] at Ynet, 1 May 2013.</ref> *13 May 2013. Three cars were torched near a mosque at the village of [[Umm al-Qutuf]] in [[Wadi Ara]]. The mosque wall was defaced with graffiti reading "price-tag" together with a [[Star of David]] and "Eviatar,"<ref>Hassan Shaalan , [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4380016,00.html 'Wadi Ara: Mosque desecrated; 3 cars set on fire,'] at [[Ynet]], 14 May 2013.</ref> *15 May 2013. It was reported that, some days earlier, vandals set fire to two cars in the village of Nein, near [[Afula]], spraying price tag graffiti.<ref>Hassan Shaalan, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4380254,00.html 'Cars torched, 'price tag' graffiti sprayed near Afula,'] at [[Ynet]] 15 May 2013.</ref> * 23 May 2013 . Price-taggers targeting Arabs also damaged Jewish property when five cars, three belonging to Arabs, two to Jews, in [[Gilo Street|Gilo]] Jerusalem suffered tire-slashing, and "price tag" was sprayed nearby.<ref>Omri Efraim, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4383557,00.html 'Jerusalem 'price taggers' damage Jewish, Arab cars,'] at [[Ynet]], 23 May 2013.</ref> *29 May 2013. In a wave of attacks, five cars in the village of [[az-Zubaidat|Zubeidat]] northeast of [[Jericho]], and four in the village of Marj en-Naaja, were torched and sprayed with graffiti reading "30 days since [[Tapuah Junction stabbing (2013)|Evyatar]] – may God avenge his death." Two cars were torched and sprayed with a similar sign at the village of [[Rantis]], west of Ramallah. In Jerusalem, seven car had their tires punctured, four of the seven at [[French Hill]], and three at the entrance to [[Shuafat]]. The graffiti read "Jewish blood is not cheap".<ref>Israel Hayom Staff,[http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php%3Fid%3D9593 'Price taggers' strike at numerous locations Tuesday Night,'] at [[Israel Hayom]], May 29, 2013</ref><ref>Jack Khoury, Jack Khoury, Chaim Levinson and Reuters, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/more-than-a-dozen-palestinian-cars-vandalized-in-apparent-settler-revenge-attack.premium-1.526589 'Wave of vandalism targets Palestinians in Jerusalem and the West Bank,'] at [[Haaretz]], 29 May 2013.</ref> * 30 May 2013. The tires of three cars were punctured in [[Beitillu|Beit Ilo]] with graffiti reading, "revenge", and on a nearby wall, undersigned with "price tag" the words "regards from Baruch Tzuri to [[Tapuah Junction stabbing (2013)|Eviatar]]", alluding to a Yitzhar settler stabbed to death by a Palestinian at [[Tapuah|Tapuah Junction]] near [[Nablus]] on April 30.<ref name="haaretz.com">Nir Hasson and Gili Cohen,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/jerusalem-s-dormition-church-suffers-suspected-price-tag-attack.premium-1.527075 'Jerusalem's Dormition Church suffers suspected 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]], 30 May 2013</ref> * 30 May 2013. Jerusalem's [[Dormition Abbey]] on [[Mount Zion]] was sprayed, for the second time in several months, with graffiti reading 'Jesus is a monkey', and the tires of two cars parked there were slashed, apparently in retribution for the dismantling of an illegal outpost, [[Havat Ma'on]].<ref name="haaretz.com"/> *12 June 2013 On several Orthodox Christian tombs the words "Price tag," and "revenge" were sprayed, at a Christian cemetery in [[Jaffa]]. Allusions were also made to two [[Bat Yam]] synagogues defaced with Nazis symbols in May.<ref name="Ben Hartman 2013"/> * 13 June 2013. Vandals set fire to two cars in a [[Sheikh Jarrah]] parking lot, in a price tag act police believe was racially motivated.<ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4392295,00.html 'Jerusalem: 2 vehicles torched in Sheikh Jarrah,'] at [[Ynet]] 14 June 2013.</ref> * 18 June 2013. 'Arabs out' graffiti were sprayed and tires of 28 cars slashed at [[Abu Ghosh]].<ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir ,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4393746,00.html ''Arabs out' graffiti in Abu Ghosh,'] at [[Ynet]], 18 June 2013.</ref> One of the damaged vehicles belonged to former [[Knesset]] [[speaker (politics)|speaker]] [[Avraham Burg]].<ref name="ynetnews.com"/> * 22 June 2013 The tires of 21 Palestinian cars were punctured and slashed at [[Beit Hanina]], accompanied by the graffiti, 'We do not keep silent over stone-throwing' and the Star of David.<ref>Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/tires-slashed-graffiti-sprayed-in-fourth-suspected-price-tag-attack-in-a-month-1.531662 'Tires slashed, graffiti sprayed in fourth suspected 'price tag' attack in a month,'] at Haaretz, 23 June 2013.</ref> * 19 August 2013. The hallway of the [[Beit Jimal Monastery|Beit Jamal Monastery]] near [[Beit Shemesh]], run by the nuns of the Sisters of Bethlehem, was firebombed and the slogans "price tag," "death to the Gentiles," and "revenge" were sprayed on its walls.<ref>Nir Hasson/Associated Press, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.542771 'Monastery near Jerusalem defaced in suspected 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]] 21 August 2013.</ref> * 22 September 2013. 8 cars of Palestinian residents in the [[Sheikh Jarrah]] sector of East Jerusalem were vandalized by tire-slashing and spray painting of price tag slogans.<ref>Nir Hasson,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.548276 'East Jerusalem vehicles vandalized in so-called 'price tag' attack,'] at [[Haaretz]], 22 September 2013.</ref> * 29 September 2013. Vandals damaged seven vehicles of Palestinian residents of East Jerusalem, near the [[Tomb of Simeon the Just]] scratching them with keys and a screwdriver, the second incident in a week suspected to be undertaken as revenge attacks on Palestinians for Israel's policy on the West Bank.<ref name="Nir Hasson 2013">Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.549846 'J'lem vehicles vandalized in third 'price tag' attack in a week,'] at Haaretz 1 October 2013.</ref> Two Jewish teenagers were subsequently arrested on suspicion of involvement.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.549431 ','] Haaretz 29 September 2013.</ref> *Police arrested 4 Jewish youths, two identified as [[Hilltop Youth]], in the act of smashing 15 gravestones in the Christian cemetery near [[King David's Tomb]] in Jerusalem in order to prevent a fully-fledged 'price tag' attack from being carried out.<ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4434491,00.html '4 Jewish youth smash Christian tombstones ,'] at [[Ynet]], 29 September 2013.</ref> *1 October 2013. Vandals slashed the tires of 5 vehicles along Ma'ale HaShalom road, and sprayed 'price tag policy' on a nearby wall in Jerusalem's [[Old City (Jerusalem)|Old Quarter]], near the house of a Palestinian family who were granted a stay of eviction from their home by the Israeli Supreme Court. It was the fifth such episode over the week.<ref name="Noam 2013"/><ref name="Nir Hasson 2013"/> *10 October 2013. The Palestinian elementary school of [[Jalud]] was attacked, reportedly by some 20 settlers, five cars owned by the teachers were damaged, and then the village's olive groves were set on fire, causing damage to 400 trees.<ref name="Jack Khoury 2013">Jack Khoury, Gili Cohen and Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.551660 'West Bank mosque defaced in second 'price tag' attack in 12 hours,'] at [[Haaretz]] 10 October 2013.</ref><ref>[[Amira Hass]], [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.551568 'Israelis attack school in Palestinian village, torch olive groves,'] at Haaretz 10 October 2013</ref> * 10 October 2013. A mosque in the West Bank Palestinian village of [[Burqa, Nablus|Burqa]] was defaced with a slogan reading "Redemption of Zion loves Tomer Hazan," and three cars were set on fire in what is suspected to be a "price tag" attack. Tomer Hazan referring an IDF soldier murdered in [[Qalqilyah]] in September.<ref name="Jack Khoury 2013"/> *14 November 2013. A Palestinian home in the West Bank village of [[Sinjil]] was set alight, with 5 Palestinians suffering from smoke inhalation. Half the house was destroyed. The owners attributed the act to four settlers. On one of the walls, the slogan "Regards from Eden, Revenge" was painted. It is suspected it was a price tag assault partially to avenge the murder of a 19 yr old IDF soldier, Eden Attias, at [[Afula]], earlier.<ref>Gili Cohen , Jack Khoury and Chaim Levinson , [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.557975 'Assailants set West Bank house on fire, spray 'Regards from Eden' on wall,'] at Haaretz, 14 November 2013.</ref> * 19 November 2013 Two vehicles were torched and Stars of David were sprayed painted on the walls of the Palestinian village of Farata. In February 2014 three settlers from the West Bank outpost of [[Havat Gilad|Gilad Farm]] were arrested for an alleged responsible for the incident.<ref>Tovah Lazaroff,[http://www.jpost.com/National-News/3-residents-of-Gilad-Farm-outpost-arrested-charged-in-price-tag-attacks-340429 ] at [[Jerusalem Post]], 5 February 2014.</ref> On December 1, 2014 two residents of Havat Gilad,Yehuda Savir and Yehuda Lansberg, were convicted for the crime, after entering plea-bargain in which they gave evidence against a third accomplice, Binyamin Richter, in exchange for 30 months in prison and no fine.<ref>Chaim Levinson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.629388 'Two settlers convicted of torching Palestinian-owned car,'] [[Haaretz]] 1 December 2014.</ref> *8 December 2013. The mosque of [[Baqa al-Gharbiyye]] in Israel was defaced by graffiti reading "Mohammed is a pig," "mutual responsibility," "Terror stones", and "regards from Boaz and David Chai", while the windshields of 5 nearby cars were shattered. Boaz and Chai refers to two settlers whose movements have been restricted by the IDF.<ref>Eli Ashkenazi,Jack Khoury [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.562348 'Mosque in Israel defaced by anti-Muslim graffiti,'] at [[Haaretz]], 8 December 2013.</ref><ref>Hassan Shaalan, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4462585,00.html ''Mohammed is a pig' sprayed on Baqa al-Gharbiyye mosque,'] at [[Ynet]], 8 December 2013.</ref>
==2014== A steep rise in attacks occurred after April 2 following the demolition of illegal outposts in the [[Yitzhar]] settlement, with some 16 hate crimes taking place in little over a month, as compared to 17 registered in the peceding three months.<ref name="Amos Harel 2014">Amos Harel, Revital Hovel, Jack Khoury,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.589469 'Security sources: 100 followers of racist rabbi are behind hate crimes,'] [[Haaretz]] 8 May 2014.</ref> From January through to mid May, the Israeli police unit for nationalist crimes, has opened 78 new files, arrested 102 suspects and served 37 indictments.<ref>Tova Tsimuki, ['Israel intensifies campaign against 'price tag' attackers,'][[Ynet]], 11 May 2014.</ref> [[File:Peace Now Price Tag 310114 016.jpg|thumb|January 31, 2014, graffiti on a Palestinian house outside [[Ma'ale Levona]]. "Jews Wake Up!", "Death to the Arabs", "Revenge!"]]
*6 January 2014. In the village of Madama south of Nablus two Palestinian vehicles were burnt out and graffiti was found next to the cars reading "Esh Kodesh", "revenge", and price tag along with a Star of David<ref>Amos Harel, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.567557 'Humiliated by Palestinians and army, extremist settlers could escalate violence,'] in [[Haaretz]], 8 January 2014</ref><ref>Abed Qusini,[http://www.smh.com.au/world/palestinian-villagers-detain-beat-alleged-israeli-settlers-20140108-hv7u8.html 'Palestinian villagers detain, beat Israeli settlers,'] at [[Sydney Morning Herald]], 8 January 2014.</ref><ref name="Yaakov Lappin" >Yaakov Lappin,[http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Price-tag-attack-in-West-Bank-following-prevented-lynch-of-settlers-337443 'Price tag' attack in West Bank following prevented lynch of settlers,] [[Jerusalem Post]], 8 January 2014.</ref><ref name="Raved" >Ahiya Raved ,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4475293,00.html 'Settler 'terror': Price tag in Kfar Qassem, foiled plot against demolisher,'] at [[Ynet]], 10 January 2014</ref> *7 January 2014. Cars were burnt and price tag graffiti, reading "Esh Kodesh", "revenge", and a [[Star of David]], were sprayed in Madama, a Palestinian village south of Nablus.<ref name="Yaakov Lappin" /><ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx%3FID%3D663549 'Settlers torch 2 Palestinian vehicles near Nablus,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]], 8 January 2014.</ref> *8 January 2014. 30 fruit trees were cut down in a Palestinian garden center next to [[Kfar Qasim|Kfar Qassem]]. The site was blazed with the slogan "Regards Eish Kodesh."<ref name="Raved"/> *15 January 2014. A mosque in the village of [[Deir Istiya]] near [[Ariel (city)|Ariel]] was set fire to, and the slogans "Arabs Out","Hi from Qusra' and "Revenge for spilled blood in Qusra" sprayed on its walls.<ref>Chaim Levinson, Gili Cohen and Jack Khoury , [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.568700 'Palestinian mosque set on fire in suspected hate crime,'] at [[Haaretz]], 15 January 2014.</ref><ref>Abed Qusini and Ori Lewis,[https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/01/15/us-israel-palestinians-mosque-idUSBREA0E0A120140115 'West Bank mosque partly torched in suspected settler attack,'] [[Reuters]], 15 January 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4476982,00.html 'Suspected price tag: Mosque door burned in village near Ariel,' ], [[Ynet]] 15 January 2014</ref> * 30 January 2014. Vandals smeared graffiti on a synagogue [[Reform Judaism|affiliated to progressive Judaism]] at [[Ra'anana]]. The graffiti referred to those who 'rise up against God' and cited a passage in [[Maimonides]] that asserts renegades, heretics and deniers of [[Torah]] have no place in the world to come, unless they repent. Commentators interpreted this as a price tag attack.<ref>Steven Klein and Yair Ettinger, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.571414 Vandals hit Reform synagogue in Ra'anana,'] at [[Haaretz]], January 30, 2014.</ref><ref>Emily L. Hauser, [http://www.haaretz.com/opinion/.premium-1.572001Why we must raise the alarm about settler violence,'] at [[Haaretz]], Feb. 3, 2014 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *9 February 2014.16 cars have their tires punctured and anti-Arab graffiti reading 'Arab labour', 'Enough of assimilation', were sprayed in the Ein Ilouza neighbourhood of [[Silwan]].<ref>['Vandals slash tires of 16 cars, spray anti-Arab graffiti in East Jerusalem,'] [[Haaretz]] 20 February 2014.</ref> * 11 March 2014. 19 cars in the Israel Arab town of [[Jaljulia]] had all their tires punctured, acid thrown on the vehicles and walls of newly built houses defaced with graffiti reading "Every Arab is a criminal" and "God is the King" in Hebrew, in what is described as a price tag attack.<ref>Leora Eren Frucht, [http://www.haaretz.com/opinion/.premium-1.580122 'Purim in Jaljulya,'], [[Haaretz]] 16 March 2014</ref> * 24 March 2014. The tires of 34 cars were slashed in a suspected price tag attack in the Arab suburb of [[Beit Hanina]] in East Jerusalem. It was the second such attack on the area within a year. Graffiti reading "[[Goy]]im in Israel = Enemies" was sprayed on a nearby bus.<ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4502577,00.html ‘Tires of 34 cars punctured in East Jerusalem neighborhood,'] [[Ynet]] 24 March 2014.</ref> * 1 April 2014 The tires of four cars were slashed and on the walls of the Catholic monastery at [[Deir Rafat]] village, close to [[Tzora|Kibbutz Tzora]] near [[Beit Shemesh]]. The graffiti read "America is Nazi Germany", "Price Tag", "Jesus is a monkey" and "Mary is a cow."<ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4505485,00.html ''Price tag': 'Nazi America' was sprayed in a monastery near Beit Shemesh,'] [[Ynet]] 1 April 2014</ref><ref>[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency|JTA]], [http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/monastery-near-beit-shemesh-vandalized-with-anti-american-epithets/2014/04/01/ 'Monastery near Beit Shemesh Vandalized With Anti-American Epithets,'] [[The Jewish Press]] April 1, 2014.</ref> * 3 April 2014. The slogan ' "Only goys [non-Jews] can be driven out of our land,"' was spray-painted on a wall and the tires of 40 cars were slashed in the predominantly Christian Israeli village of [[Jish]] in what Elias Elias, head of the Gush Halav Regional Counci, described as 'price tag' damage.<ref>[http://www.timesofisrael.com/tires-slashed-in-latest-racist-attack-in-galilee/#ixzz2xpAqK7Yd 'Tires slashed in latest racist attack in Galilee,'] [[The Times of Israel]], 3 April 2014.</ref> * 18 April 2014. The door of the Abu-Bakr Al-Siddiq mosque at [[Umm al-Fahm]] was set alight and a slogan reading 'Arabs out' scrawled on its wall.<ref>Hassan Shaalan ,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4511683,00.html 'Hundreds protest 'price tag' attacks in Umm al-Fahm,'] [[Ynet]], 21 April 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4511112,00.html 'Umm al-Fahm mosque vandalized, door torched,'] [[Ynet]], 18 April 2014.</ref> *28 April 2014. The tires of several local cars were slashed, and the Star of David, and an exhortation to 'Close mosques, not yeshivas' were sprayed on a mosque in the Israeli Arab town of [[Fureidis]]. It was, according to the head of Tag Meir (Spreading the Light) Gadi Gvaryahu, the 31st case of a house of worship in either Israel or the West Bank being subject to desecration since 2009.<ref>Eli Ashkenazi and Jack Khoury, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.587963 'Mosque targeted in hate crime, second in two weeks,'] [[Haaretz]], 290 April 2014.</ref> *29 April 2014.The tires of an Israeli Arab's car were slashed, and the doors painted with the Star of David, when the man left his car parked in the predominantly Jewish neighbourhood of [[Yokneam Illit|Yokneam]], the sixth such incident in the town in a month.<ref>Eli Ashkenazi and Jack Khoury,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/.premium-1.588201 'Israeli Arab man's car vandalized in another apparent hate crime,'] [[Haaretz]] 30 April 2014.</ref> An admirer of the ideas of Rabbi [[Meir Kahane]] was arrested on May 7 on suspicion of having damaged Arab cars in the town.<ref name="Amos Harel 2014"/> *4 May 2014. The tires of a car belonging to an Arab resident of [[Acre, Israel|Acre]] were slashed while it was parked at [[Ein HaShofet]], and the vandals drew a Star of David together with "price tag" on one of the tires.<ref name="Police-suspect-price-tag-incidents-near-Jerusalem-Acre-351262 2014">[http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Police-suspect-price-tag-incidents-near-Jerusalem-Acre-351262 'Police suspect 'price tag' incidents near Jerusalem, Acre,'] [[Jerusalem Post]], 4 May 2014.</ref> *5 May 2014. A column outside the Office of the Assembly of Bishops at the Notre Dame Center in East Jerusalem was smeared with a graffito in Hebrew:"Death to Arabs and Christians and all those who hate Israel".</<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4517625,00.html 'Anti-Christian graffiti raise alarm before Pope's Holy Land visit,'] [[Ynet]], 5 May 2014.</ref><ref>Jeffrey Heller, [http://in.reuters.com/article/2014/05/08/uk-israel-church-idINKBN0DO0WF20140508 'Anti-Christian graffiti raise alarm before Pope's Holy Land visit,'] Reuters 8 May 2014</ref> *5 May 2014. Graffiti reading "price tag" and "Kahane was right" were sprayed on the walls of Arab property at the Israeli town of [[Kiryat Ye'arim]].<ref name="Police-suspect-price-tag-incidents-near-Jerusalem-Acre-351262 2014"/> *7 May 2014. A [[Druze]] had the windows of his dentistry practice scrawled over with the slogans "Death to Arabs" and "Greetings to Fureidis, Price Tag," in [[Yokneam Illit|Yokneam]].<ref>Eli Ashkenazi,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.589291 'Vandals scrawl 'Death to Arabs' on window of Druze business in northern Israel,'] [[Haaretz]] 7 May 2014.</ref> *9 May 2014. Graffiti reading 'Price tag, King David is for the Jews, Jesus is garbage' were sprayed on the walls of the St. George Romanian Orthodox Church in Jerusalem.<ref>[[Associated Press]], [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4517888,00.html 'Jerusalem church defaced weeks before pope visit,'] [[Ynet]], 9 May 2014.</ref><ref>Nir Hasson,[http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.589744 'Jerusalem church defaced in latest hate crime attack,' ] [[Haaretz]], 9 May 2014.</ref> *16 June 2014.The tires of an IDF military vehicle transporting toilets were slashed in an apparent price tag incident at the [[Yitzhar]] settlement.<ref>Yoav Zitun, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4531200,00.html 'Tires slashed in Yitzhar as IDF searches for kidnapped teens,'] [[Ynet]] 16 June 2014.</ref> *19 June 2014. A [[Haifa]] Arab-Israeli school was defaced with "price tag", "Death to Arabs" and invective against Knesset member [[Hanin Zoabi]], and signs of an incendiary attempt were also visible.<ref name="ToI" >{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/tires-slashed-in-suspected-racist-attack/|title=Tires slashed in suspected racist attack|work=The Times of Israel|accessdate=31 July 2015}}</ref> *23 June 2014. Three cars in [[Beit Hanina|al-Ashqariya neighborhood of Beit Hanina]] had their tyres punctured, another four were deflated, with slogans "revenge" and "every Arab is the enemy" sprayed on them. Palestinian sources say 12 cars and a school bus were affected.<ref name="ToI" /><ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=707029 'Settlers vandalize 12 Palestinian cars in East Jerusalem,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 23 June 2014.</ref> *2 July 2014 [[Kidnapping and murder of Mohammed Abu Khdeir|A Palestinian boy, Abu Khdeir]] was kidnapped, beaten up and torched to death after being doused with petrol, by three Israeli youths in what was deemed a price tag attack.<ref>Lynda Franken, [http://www.thejerusalemfund.org/ht/display/ContentDetails/i/47435 Violent settler attacks against Palestinians have risen since the start of ‘Operation Protective Edge’] [[Jerusalem Fund]], August 4, 2014. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402162328/http://www.thejerusalemfund.org/ht/display/ContentDetails/i/47435 |date=April 2, 2015 }}</ref> *2 July 2014. In the wake of the [[2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers]], settlers who, according to Palestinian sources, hailed from the settlement of [[Itamar]], sprayed the slogans "blood vengeance" and "price tag" on Fadi Basim Bani Jabir's sheep farm in [[Aqraba, Nablus|Aqraba]], and torched the steel structure fencing it. The sheep were saved.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=709309 'Israeli settlers torch Palestinian farm in 'price tag' attack,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 3 July 2014.</ref> * 9 August 2014. Settlers reportedly burnt a minibus and sprayed 'price tag' on a wall in the village of [[Yasuf]]. Palestinian security sources claim that the attackers hailed from the settlement of [[Kfar Tapuach|Tapuach]].<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=719461 'Settlers raid Salfit-area village in apparent price tag attack,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 10 August 2014</ref> * 5–6 October 2014. Dozens of olive trees were felled in the village of [[Yasuf]] and a further 15 were damaged in the village of [[Burin, Nablus|Burin]] in a suspected pricetag attack. Settlers claim that th cuts were th result of Palestinian pruning, which "leftist Israelis" exploited to make a [[blood libel]] against the settlers.<ref>Elior Levy, Itay Blumenthal, [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4578302,00.html 'Dozens of olive trees destroyed in West Bank in run-up to harvest,'] [[Ynet]] 6 October 2014</ref> On 11 October police arrested two Israelis from [[Tapuach]] on suspicion of involvement in the assault.<ref name="Elior Levy" /> *14 October 2014.The mosque of [[Aqraba, Nablus|Aqraba]], near the settlement of [[Itamar]] was torched by a firebomb and the graffiti "price tag [[Tapuach]]" was sprayed on a wall nearby.<ref name="Elior Levy" >Elior Levy ,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4580364,00.html 'Mosque torched in West Bank 'price tag' attack ,'] [[Ynet]] 14 October 2014</ref> *11 November 2014. Vandals damaged several cars while spray-painted "No Arabs, no cars" at [[Beit Safafa]] in a suspected price-tag attack, in the wake of several incidents involving Palestinians ploughing two cars into crowds, a spate of attacks on Arabs, the knifing of two Jews, and police and IDF killings of protesting Palestinians.<ref>http://wwwtimesofisrael.com/police-probing-anti-arab-vandalism-in-jerusalem-as-tensions-swirl/ 'Police probe anti-Arab vandalism, boost patrols as tensions swirl,'] [[The Times of Israel]] 11 November 2014.</ref> *12 November 2014. Settlers reportedly torched the mosque at [[al-Mughayyir]] and spraypainted racist slogans at the site.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=739391 'Israeli settlers torch mosque in Ramallah-area village,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 12 November 2014</ref><ref>Noam (Dabul) Dvir,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4591050,00.html 'Mosque set ablaze in West Bank; synagogue attacked,'] [[Ynet]] 12 November 2014</ref> *23 November 2014. In a suspected price tag operation, settlers, attacking with Molotov cocktails and stun grenades, torched the home of the widow of Abd al-Karim Hussein Hamayil in [[Khirbet Abu Falah]], scrawling "Death to the Arabs," and "Avenge the blood of the fallen servants" in Hebrew at the site.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=741899 'Israeli settlers torch Palestinian home near Ramallah,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 23 November 2014.</ref><ref>[http://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-house-torched-in-suspected-hate-crime/ 'Palestinian house torched in suspected hate crime,' ] [[The Times of Israel]] 23 November 2014.</ref> *29 November 2014 The bilingual Jewish-Arab [[Max Rayne]] [[Hand in Hand: Center for Jewish Arab Education in Israel|Hand in Hand school]] in the [[Pat, Jerusalem|Pat Neighbourhood]] of Jerusalem was torched by vandals, who sprayed slogans like "enough with assimilation", "you [[eliminationism|can't coexist with a cancer]]," "Kahane was right" and "death to Arabs".<ref>Ben Hartman ,[http://new.jpost.com/Israel-News/Bilingual-Hebrew-Arabic-school-in-Jerusalem-caught-in-flames-383176 'Jerusalem bilingual Hebrew-Arabic school ablaze in suspected hate crime ,'] [[Jerusalem Post]] 29 November 2014.</ref><ref>[[Associated Press]][http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/police-fire-damages-bilingual-jerusalem-school-27252488 'Police Say Fire Damages Bilingual Jerusalem School,'] [[ABC News]] 29 November 2014.</ref> 3 Members of the radical right-wing group [[Lehava]], Yitzah Gabay and the brothers Nahman and Shlomo Twitto, were arrested on suspicion of the arson on December 6, and later admitted their culpability. One of their mothers said:'It's disgusting that Jews and Arabs learn side by side . . If we didn't have a country governed by law, I would have done the same.<ref>Itay Blumenthal,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4602506,00.html 'Three far-right activists admit to burning Jewish-Arab Jerusalem school,'] [[Ynet]] 12 December 2014.</ref>
==2015== [[File:Price Tag RabinSqr 010815.jpg|thumb|A [[Meretz]] sign at a demonstration against Price Tags attacks at [[Rabin Square]] on 1 August 2015. "Terror Tag: this is not a youth movement, and these are not pranks" ]] * 14 January 2015. 11 vehicles in the Palestinian neighborhood of [[Beit Safafa]], [[East Jerusalem]], had their tires punctured and the cars sprayed with hate graffiti, one referring to a "demarcation order", alluding to an order to demolish an illegal settler outpost. [[Hilltop youth]] are suspected.<ref>[http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=753778 'Jewish vandals attack vehicles, spray graffiti in East Jerusalem,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 14 January 2015.</ref><ref>Nir Hasson, [http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.637092 'Hate crime in Jerusalem: Tires on 11 cars in Beit Safafa punctured,'] [[Haaretz]] 14 January 2015</ref> * 26 February 2015. An arson attack on a Greek Orthodox seminary for the study of Christianity next to [[Jaffa Gate]] in Jerusalem destroyed the bathroom. The walls were smeared with graffiti, including "Jesus is a son of a bitch", and "the Redemption of Zion".<ref>Roi Yanovsky,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4631052,00.html 'Christian seminary set alight in suspected hate crime ,'] [[Ynet]] 25 February 2015.</ref> The action was defined as a price tag attack by the Arab Joint List party.<ref>Judah Ari Gross,[http://www.timesofisrael.com/jerusalem-christian-seminary-targeted-in-alleged-hate-crime/ 'Jerusalem Christian seminary targeted in apparent hate crime,'] [[The Times of Israel]] 26 February 2015.</ref> * 5 March 2015. Two cars were torched, and price-tag graffiti in Hebrew ( "Death to Arabs" and "Glory to the Jews") were sprayed on walls, in the village of [[Al-Mughayyir, Ramallah|Mughayyir]]. Locals suspect that [[Adei Ad]] settlers are responsible.<ref>[http://www.maannews.com/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=759741 'Settlers torch 2 Palestinian cars near Ramallah,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 5 March 2015.</ref> * 18 June 2015. In a suspected price tag attack by extremists, arsonists burnt down part of the [[Benedictine Order|Benedictine]] [[Church of the Multiplication]] at [[Tabgha]], on the [[Sea of Galilee]]. The walls were daubed with the words "The false gods will be eliminated" , a citation from a Jewish prayer. 16 Israeli youths, 10 from the settlement of [[Yitzhar]] were briefly detained for interrogation and then released.<ref>[http://www.timesofisrael.com/left-wing-lawmakers-to-visit-burned-jesus-loaves-church/ 'Left-wing lawmakers visit burned ‘Jesus loaves’ church,'] [[The Times of Israel]] 19 June 2015.</ref><ref>[http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?id=766043 'Israeli settlers suspected in church arson attack released,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]]19 June 2015.</ref> On July 12, police arrested several Israeli youths on suspicion of being behind the arson attack.<ref>[http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?id=766458 'Israel arrests Jewish suspects over church arson,'] [[Ma'an News Agency]] 12 July 2015.</ref> * 31 July 2015. 18-month-old Ali Saad Dawabsha was killed, two houses burnt down and three family members, including a 4-year-old child, hospitalized with severe burns after a suspected arson attack by Jewish extremists in [[Duma, Nablus|Duma]], near [[Nablus]].<ref>{{cite web|title = News – Palestinian baby dies in 'price tag' arson attack|url = http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4686046,00.html|accessdate = 2015-07-31}}</ref> Graffiti was left on the walls saying "Long live Messiah the king", "Price Tag" and "Revenge".<ref>{{cite web|title = Suspected Jewish extremists attack Palestinian village in West Bank, killing child|url = https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2015/07/31/israeli-military-child-killed-in-west-bank-attack|accessdate = 2015-07-31}}</ref> The attack is suspected to be in reaction to the Israeli government demolishing illegally built houses in [[Beit El]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.669043|newspaper=Haaretz|date=August 2, 2015|accessdate=August 2, 2015|first=Amos|last=Harel|title=Ya'alon backs harsh measures against rightists suspected of attacking Palestinians}}</ref> * 13 August. A Bedouin tent, used as a storage place for animal feed, was torched by two youths, one, Avi Gavny, identified the following month as belonging to the [[Hilltop youth]]. A graffiti in Hebrew reading "Administrators of Revenge" was found on the site.<ref>Ben Hartman,[http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Two-Israelis-charged-with-arson-on-Beduin-tent-in-West-Bank-415463 'Two Israelis charged with torching Beduin tent in suspected 'Price Tag' incident,'] [[Jerusalem Post]] 7 September 2015.</ref> * 1–2 October. A number of price tag attacks on Palestinian property and persons occurred overnight after the drive by killing of an Israeli couple in the West Bank.<ref>Elior Levy, Itay Blumenthal,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4706354,00.html 'West Bank tensions surge in night of 'price tag' attacks,'] [[Ynet]]2 October 2015.</ref>
